channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various holes in the road, need repair as trip hazard and causing damage to vehicles, 11th January
item.description:
Outside no 5 and 7 rookery Road Innsworth : Has been like it since before Christmas
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rookery Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large deep pothole, 11th January
item.description:
Albert Road, where one direction has to give way to oncoming traffic so is obviously being driven on more. Not sure if I have exact postal code but there are only 2 areas as described above so can easily be recognised. It is very deep and wide and cant be avoided. There are also other bad areas in general of the road surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: 3 large potholes, 11th January
item.description:
2 potholes on road outside 29 Bournside Road, 1 large pothole outside 34 Bournside Road. Road is frequently used by cyclists going to Bournside and Dean Close schools - also clogged by builders vehicles during the day reducing vision of the hazards. Danger to cyclists and cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Bournside Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 potholes appeared after a burst water pipe. Severn Trent fixed the pipe under the pavement but not the road., 11th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Harrison Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large pot hole near bend and entrance to Hayfield Homes Development work entrance, 11th January
item.description:
Pothole is on the near side of road (heading towards Gotherington) just before Hayfields development. It is just before bend in road so makes it difficult for drivers to avoid pothole. Many pot holes appearing on the side of the road from this point up to Gotherington Village sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This whole road needs urgent repair, 11th January
item.description:
The whole stretch of road is in a terrible way. Potholes, complete surface worn away, edges destroyed. Its dangerous and even more so when wet or foggy. It has got worse due to the ongoing repairs to the London Road Bridge in Charlton Kings as people are using it as a bypass for the never ending repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole on the edge of the road, westbound, 11th January
item.description:

item.title: Huge pothole in the middle of the road, 11th January
item.description:
Opposite the petrol station. In the middle of the road but more on the side heading towards the traffic light junction. Huge in size, looks deep. Drove through it during the rain as couldn’t see it and it’s a miracle it didn’t damage my car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broad pothole just past the entrance to the Texaco garage., 11th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Albert Road chicanes, 11th January
item.description:
On both chicanes on Albert Road there are extremely large potholes. Dangerous for cyclists on narrowing stretch and pedestrians crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 very large Traffic cones and 2 street closed signs dumped, 11th January
item.description:
I don't know if I am wasting my time reporting this for the second time as no action has been taken to remove these objects fly tipped by your highway contractors. If we can fine individuals for fly tipping then set an example your selves. These items have been on site since the 10km charity run last October!!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
